question: Which solution should a researcher use if they want High accuracy and data export?
ground_truth_answer: A researcher who values high accuracy and needs to export data for further analysis should use the Building Acoustics Partner or DIRAC software with the HBK 2255 Sound Level Meter. These solutions are designed for precise acoustic measurements and make it easy to export data in formats such as Excel or text files for advanced processing or reporting.

You can simultaneously measure source (L1) and receiving room levels (L2) by connecting two HBK 2255 Sound Level Meters to the app.  This feature is designed to save time and enhance efficiency, especially when working in pairs.
 Back in the office, the PC app makes short work of analysis and reporting.
 Mobile App
The Building Acoustics Partner mobile app brings an entirely new level of efficiency and control to sound insulation measurements.  Measurement planning and workflow automation in the mobile app help to ensure that you never miss a measurement position, while easy measurement reuse between partitions helps you to minimize the total number of measurements.  We understand that plans often change due to site conditions on real-world projects, and the app makes it easy to alter the plan at any time.
 PC App
Sound insulation testing projects don’t end when the last measurement is completed – the measurement data still needs to be analyzed and a report needs to be created.

Mobile App

Measurement planning and workflow automation in the mobile app help to ensure that you never miss a measurement position, while easy measurement reuse between partitions helps you to minimize the total number of measurements.  We understand that plans often change due to site conditions on real-world projects, and the app makes it easy to alter the plan at any time.
 PC App
Sound insulation testing projects don’t end when the last measurement is completed – the measurement data still needs to be analyzed and a report needs to be created.  The Building Acoustics Partner PC app is designed to make these tasks as efficient as possible, while providing the maximum level of insight and confidence in your data.

 It is a best practice to check the accuracy of your instrument before and after a measurement by performing a cal-
ibration check.  A calibration check is not a calibration.  Calibration includes an adjustment of the instrument's sensitivity.
 A calibration check compares the current sensitivity of the instrument with the sensitivity from its most recent and ini-

question: Which solution should I use if I want compatibility with analysis tools like matlab?
ground_truth_answer: For full compatibility with analysis tools like MATLAB, the best option is the HBK 2255 with the Open Interface BZ-7400 license or DIRAC software. Both allow you to export results in open formats like ASCII or .txt files, making it easy to perform custom analyses and post-processing in MATLAB or similar tools.

question: Which solution is better for a university group? They want to use this solution in different applications.
ground_truth_answer: A university group should use the HBK 2255 platform, as it supports multiple dedicated apps for different measurement tasks. The same instrument can be licensed for several applications — such as Noise Partner, Work Noise Partner, Building Acoustics Partner, and more — allowing students or researchers to switch easily between types of acoustic measurements. The DIRAC software is also excellent for teaching and research in room acoustics.

ground_truth_segments.text:
Accurate noise measurement, analysis and reporting has never been more simple.

 HBK 2255 Sound Level Meter is an advanced, single-channel, class 1 measurement solution.  Designed for users with varied and complex workloads, HBK 2255 can be relied upon to get the job done efficiently and with maximum confidence.  HBK 2255 works seamlessly with a range of apps, each providing a complete solution for a specific job-to-do.  Accurate acoustic measurement, analysis and documentation has never been so simple.

 A sound level meter is a measuring instrument, designed to measure sound levels in a standardized way.Commonly referred to as a sound meter, noise meter, decibel meter, or sound pressure level (SPL) meter, a sound level meter is designed to respond to sound in approximately the same way as the human ear.The purpose of a sound level meter is to give objective, reproducible measurements of sound pressure levels (SPL).

 At its very core, a sound level meter basically consists of a microphone, a preamplifier, a signal processing unit, and a display.

See “Ordering information” for a complete overview.

About DIRAC
To investigate the acoustical properties of a room, you can clap 
your hands and listen to the response of the room.  Although it 
may not be easy to describe accurately what you hear, this 
method gives you an impression of whether music would sound 
pleasant or speech would be intelligible in this room.  DIRAC uses 
this principle as the basis for measuring the acoustical properties 
of a system through impulse responses.

question: Which solution should I use to measure noise levels in a factory floor?
ground_truth_answer: To measure noise levels on a factory floor, use the HBK 2255 with Work Noise Partner (BZ-7302). This solution is built for workplace noise surveys, guiding you through full workday noise exposure calculations and helping you assess whether hearing protection is required. It’s ideal for occupational and industrial noise assessments.

question: What solution should I use to see if a construction site follows the noise regulations?
ground_truth_answer: For checking noise compliance on a construction site, use the HBK 2255 with Enviro Noise Partner (BZ-7301). This setup is designed for environmental noise surveys and includes tools like markers to isolate unwanted sounds and checklists to ensure every step follows local requirements.

ground_truth_segments.text:
Mobile and desktop apps can be freely downloaded and 
installed on any iOS mobile device and PC, and measurements 
made with the instrument can be easily and seamlessly edited by 
the desktop app on any PC without extra requirements.
 A platform that helps you get the job done
The B&K 2245 platform includes a range of apps, each tailored to 
assist a specific job-to-do.  Each instrument can be licenced for 
more than one app, so switching tasks is as easy as – 
switching apps.
 Noise Partner – for simple, broadband measurements, for 
general-purpose sound pressure measurements and for basic 
occupational, product and environmental measurements 
Noise Partner for Android – an Android-compatible app for 
added flexibility
Enviro Noise Partner – for environmental noise surveys that 
includes markers to isolate sounds (for example, removing a 
barking dog or identifying the moment when a sound source is 
operating) and checklists to ensure each step is completed to 
local requirements 
Work Noise Partner – for workplace noise surveys that guides 
you through a full work-day noise exposure calculation. 
 Frequency analysis is included along with tools to select 
appropriate hearing protectors when needed
Product Noise Partner – for free-field sound power 
determination according to ISO 3744 or ISO 3746, or toy noise 
assessments according to EN 71-1
All iOS mobile apps are free to download from the App Store®. 
 Noise Partner for Android™ is free to download from Google Play™. 
 PC apps are free to download at www.hbkworld.com.

question: Which solution should I use to conduct noise impact assessments? I need GPS tagging and the device to be weatherproof.
ground_truth_answer: For noise impact assessments that require GPS tagging and a weatherproof instrument, the right choice is the HBK 2255-E-S with Enviro Noise Partner. It includes GPS for accurate time and position logging, has an IP54-rated robust design for outdoor conditions, and supports environmental noise surveys with full reporting capability.

question: I want to monitore a contruction site. What should I use? I need long term logging and report generation.
ground_truth_answer: To monitor a construction site with long-term logging and automatic report generation, choose the HBK 2255-E-S with Enviro Noise Partner, along with the Logging Licence BZ-7402 or Advanced Logging Licence BZ-7450. This solution supports continuous noise monitoring, remote access, and automatic transfer of data for efficient reporting.

DIRAC Room Acoustics Software Type 7841
About DIRAC
To investigate the acoustical properties of a room, you can clap 
your hands and listen to the response of the room.  Although it 
may not be easy to describe accurately what you hear, this 
method gives you an impression of whether music would sound 
pleasant or speech would be intelligible in this room.

Type 4292-L uses 12 loudspeakers in a dodecahedral configuration to radiate sound evenly with a spherical distribution.  All speakers are connected in a series-parallel network to ensure both in-phase operation and an impedance that matches the power amplifier.
 The loudspeaker weighs less than 8 kg and is fitted with a convenient lifting handle that does not measurably interfere with the sound field.

 USE SCENARIOS
Room and building acoustics
Measuring airborne sound insulation
Measuring reverberation time
For most architectural acoustics measurements, the OmniPower sound source radiates sound evenly in all directions and gives reproducible and reliable results.  The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.
 Background noise is the enemy of good architectural acoustics measurements particularly at low frequencies where traffic noise and air conditioning systems are some of the main culprits i.e.  between 100 Hz and 200 Hz.

question: I need to measure a residential building and I need to follow the standard ISO 3382. Which solution should I use?
ground_truth_answer: The best solution is the HBK 2255 with Building Acoustics Partner. It supports all the necessary tests and measurements required under ISO 3382, including reverberation time and sound insulation performance, ensuring that your measurements are accurate and standards-compliant.

All parameters can be viewed in table and/or graph format.  Parameters 
are graphed versus frequency or source-receiver distance. 
 Measurements can be grouped, and over each group the average, 
standard deviation, minimum and maximum can be calculated.
 The calculated results of multiple groups can be displayed in a single 
graph or table.

All speakers are connected in a series-parallel network to ensure both in-phase operation and an impedance that matches the power amplifier.
 The loudspeaker weighs less than 8 kg and is fitted with a convenient lifting handle that does not measurably interfere with the sound field.

 USE SCENARIOS
Room and building acoustics
Measuring airborne sound insulation
Measuring reverberation time
For most architectural acoustics measurements, the OmniPower sound source radiates sound evenly in all directions and gives reproducible and reliable results.  The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.
 Background noise is the enemy of good architectural acoustics measurements particularly at low frequencies where traffic noise and air conditioning systems are some of the main culprits i.e.  between 100 Hz and 200 Hz.
 The OmniPower sound source is designed to deliver its peak performance in this very same range delivering maximum power where it’s needed most.

question: Which is the best solution to measure room acoustics?
ground_truth_answer: The best solution for room acoustics is the DIRAC Room Acoustics Software Type 7841, used together with the HBK 2755 Smart Power Amplifier and OmniPower Sound Source Type 4292-L. This combination is purpose-built for room and building acoustics measurements, providing high precision and support for all key parameters.

Product: Type 4292-L
URL: https://www.hbkworld.com/en/products/transducers/acoustic/sound-sources/loudspeaker/4292-l
================================================================================

OmniPower Sound Source Type 4292-L is a a dodecahedral, high-power, omnidirectional loudspeaker designed to measure sound insulation and perform room acoustics measurements.

 Type 4292-L uses 12 loudspeakers in a dodecahedral configuration to radiate sound evenly with a spherical distribution.  All speakers are connected in a series-parallel network to ensure both in-phase operation and an impedance that matches the power amplifier.

question: I need to perform sound power measurements with a multi channel setup. Which solution should I use?
ground_truth_answer: For multi-channel sound power measurements, use the HBK 2255-P-S with Product Noise Partner (BZ-7303). It supports sound power determination according to ISO 3744 and ISO 3746 and can easily handle multiple measurement channels for more complex setups. It’s the go-to solution for product noise and R&D testing.

question: I need a solution that covers standard compliance to perform sound power measurements.
ground_truth_answer: The correct choice is the HBK 2255-P-S with Product Noise Partner (BZ-7303). This setup fully complies with ISO 3744 and ISO 3746 for sound power testing, as well as IEC 61672 and IEC 61260 for sound level and filter accuracy. It’s designed for precise, standards-compliant product noise evaluations.

question: I want a solution with a simple interface and affordabe.
ground_truth_answer: If you need something simple and affordable, the HBK 2245 Sound Level Meter with Noise Partner (BZ-7300) is the best fit. It features a straightforward, user-friendly interface with only a few buttons, clear on-screen guidance, and seamless integration with mobile and PC apps for easy data management and reporting.

question: Which solutions gives basic logging and a simple interface?
ground_truth_answer: For basic logging with a simple and intuitive interface, choose the HBK 2245 with Noise Partner (BZ-7300). It supports logging at short intervals, includes straightforward controls, and offers just the essential features needed for general-purpose noise measurements — perfect for quick checks and everyday monitoring.

ground_truth_segments.text:
Mobile and desktop apps can be freely downloaded and 
installed on any iOS mobile device and PC, and measurements 
made with the instrument can be easily and seamlessly edited by 
the desktop app on any PC without extra requirements.
 A platform that helps you get the job done
The B&K 2245 platform includes a range of apps, each tailored to 
assist a specific job-to-do.  Each instrument can be licenced for 
more than one app, so switching tasks is as easy as – 
switching apps.
 Noise Partner – for simple, broadband measurements, for 
general-purpose sound pressure measurements and for basic 
occupational, product and environmental measurements 
Noise Partner for Android – an Android-compatible app for 
added flexibility
Enviro Noise Partner – for environmental noise surveys that 
includes markers to isolate sounds (for example, removing a 
barking dog or identifying the moment when a sound source is 
operating) and checklists to ensure each step is completed to 
local requirements 
Work Noise Partner – for workplace noise surveys that guides 
you through a full work-day noise exposure calculation. 
 Frequency analysis is included along with tools to select 
appropriate hearing protectors when needed
Product Noise Partner – for free-field sound power 
determination according to ISO 3744 or ISO 3746, or toy noise 
assessments according to EN 71-1
All iOS mobile apps are free to download from the App Store®. 
 Noise Partner for Android™ is free to download from Google Play™. 
 PC apps are free to download at www.hbkworld.com.

Logging of all parameters at intervals between 1 second and 1 minuteThis enables us to add new features and updates without the need to update the sound level meter.
 Made Faster
The PC software is simple to install and use.  Data is quickly and easily transferred to your PC and organized intuitively, ready for analysis and reporting, using preconfigured, user-friendly tools.

 CHARACTERISTICS
Single measurement range: 23.2 – 140.3 dB from the noise floor to maximum level,
A-weighted
Integrated GPS for time and location
Ergonomic design for comfortable single-handed operation
Colour LCD with a bright, clean layout that clearly displays measured level and measurement status
Measurement status light-ring visible from any angle
Built-in Li-Ion battery, typically providing more than 13 hours operation with Wi-Fi enabled
16 GB built-in storage for measurements and annotations
Integrated Wi-Fi and Bluetooth® Low Energy for connection to mobile and PC apps
MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES
IEC 61672-1 class 1 sound level meter
Broadband level measurements with two simultaneous frequency weightings
1/1- and/or 1/3-octave band frequency analysis for one frequency weighting
Logging of all parameters at intervals between 1 second and 1 minute
Broadband and spectral statistics for 5 percentiles.  Full level distribution stored allowing re-calculation of arbitrary percentiles in HBK apps.
 Listening quality MP3-compressed audio recording
* Available measurement features depend on installed software licenses.  Refer to product data sheet for details.

This robust, class 1 sound level meter puts functionality, 
ease-of-use and versatility into the palm of your hand together 
with the reliability and confidence that is ensured with the 
Brüel & Kjær brand.
 B&K 2245 works seamlessly with a range of apps, each providing 
a complete solution for a specific job-to-do.  Accurate noise 
measurement, analysis and documentation has never been 
so simple.

Noise measurements requiring IEC 61672-compliant (class 1), 
type-approved instrumentation 
Road vehicle exhaust noise inspection with Exhaust 
Noise Partner
Basic broadband noise measurements with Noise Partner
Environmental noise assessments with Enviro Noise Partner
Occupational noise assessments with Work Noise Partner
Free-field sound power determination according to ISO 3744 or 
ISO 3746 with Product Noise Partner
Toy noise measurements according to EN 71-1 with Product 
Noise Partner
Type-approved sound level measurement data integration with 
other systems using Open Interface for B&K 2245 and 
HBK 2255 BZ-7400 
Single measurement range: 23.2* – 140.3 dB(A) from noise 
floor to maximum level
Frequency range: 6 Hz – 20 kHz
16 GB internal storage
Supported by a range of apps tailored to specific jobs
Automatic measurement transfer to network or USB storage 
media for backup and analysis
Robust design for both indoor and outdoor measurements
Simplified user interface 
Wireless connectivity 
GPS for time and position
Calibrator auto-detection
Windscreen auto-detection and compensation
Powerful open interface for system integrators

for analysis and documentation.

 The complete solution: B&K 2245 Sound Level Meter and the Noise

The sound level meter
B&K 2245 provides effortless usability with a dust- and water-

ensured compliance to IP 55.  The seven control buttons can be 
comfortably operated with one hand, and the clear, bright display 
shows you the most important information at a single glance.
